spookynights-guide-mechanics-text:
The darkness has grown stronger. Ghostly entities now roam the world, and they are not made of flesh and bone.

Spectral Resistance
Physical weapons (Copper, Iron, Steel...) simply pass through them without full effect. All vanilla weapons suffer a -50% damage penalty against spectral creatures.

To fight them effectively, you must use weapons made of Spectrium, Etherium, or the legendary Aetherium. These metals can bypass the resistance and even inflict massive bonus damage.
spookynights-guide-metallurgy-text:
To forge weapons capable of harming ghosts, you must process the loot they drop.

1. Spectrium (Tier 1)
Hunting spectral creatures yields Spectral Hearts. Place a Hammer and a Heart in the crafting grid to crush it into Spectrium Nuggets.
Smelting point: 1025Â°C

2. Etherium (Tier 2)
An alloy made in a crucible. It requires a mix of Copper and Spectrium.
Ratio: 30-40% Spectrium / 60-70% Copper
It offers better durability and damage than Spectrium.

3. Aetherium (Tier 3)
The ultimate ghost-hunting alloy. It requires mixing Spectrium, Bismuth, and Silver in a crucible.
Ratio: ~40% Spectrium / ~40% Bismuth / ~20% Silver
spookynights-guide-weapons-text:
While Spears and Swords are effective, the spectral threat sometimes requires a different approach. The War Scythe is a specialized weapon forged from spectral metals.

Short War Scythe
A fast, versatile weapon (Range: 2.5m). Its sharp blade is also capable of harvesting animal resources.

Long War Scythe
A heavy polearm with an exceptional reach of 3.8 meters (longer than a spear). It allows you to keep dangerous entities at a safe distance while inflicting heavy sweeping damage. Perfect for fighting groups of drifters.
